text: Suggestion: in the dropdown where we have Copy Snippet ... maybe another option to copy only the value whiteout the wrapping html?
That would speed me up significantly

while I agree with the suggestion I think the reason they’re avoiding  doing this is they don’t want everyone to just use the values which will prevent a feature they want to add to the page editor down the road
<@U7SL518D6> I don't understand what you mean by that

Bueller?? Anyone??? Or can we get some legit documentation added into docs about this?? Customer Support doesn't even know about this. They tried providing me instructions on how to install FontAwesome. :face_palm::skin-tone-3:

The copy snippet feature generates html span tags. The tags while you don’t want them inside of html attributes and whatnot, they are good to have if the html will be valid. The reason is because this is the same HTML that template hubl tags generate. This HTML is used by the page editor to make fields editable inline in the page.

I’ve directly asked a few HS team members if they plan to one day make it possible to edit individual fields inline in the page for custom modules, they said it’s a little ways down the road but yes it’s something they would like to do.
so in other words if you choose to always strip out the value, you are actually removing a convenience feature from your custom modules down the road.
while you are right, i'm still to find a client that actually edits their own pages :slightly_smiling_face:
i noticed the new icon field, but haven't used it so far ... would like to know the answer to your question too.

Hey Josh, sorry for the lack of documentation on the new icon field. You should be able to use the default code from “copy snippet” ```{% icon
	name="{{ module.icon_field.name }}"
	style="{{ module.icon_field.type }}"
	unicode="{{ module.icon_field.unicode }}"
%}``` which should render the correct tags for the icon
If that’s not working, can you send me an example?
